info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 2:17PM MDT until July 31 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall over the Black burn scar is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Sierra. * WHEN...Until 415 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. There is little additional rainfall expected at this time from the storm. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Fork Palomas Creek, Cherry Creek and Morgan Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hermosa. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying spots. In hilly terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
